# Using R to make movies

While most of the visualizations made in R are `static`, with a single image 
displaying the data, one can also make videos in R. These are particularly 
useful when data has a temporal component or a third axis for display. Here
we will show a few ways to make videos using R and airport weather data 

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(riem) # Precipitation data
library(animation) #movie making
library(USAboundaries) # boundary data
library(gganimate) #another way to make movies
library(lubridate)
library(ggthemes)
library(tmap)
library(sf)
library(gifski)
theme_set(theme_few()) # Set ggplot theme



knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


# Data acquisition and reshaping


## Finding our station names

```{r}
#riem_networks() # look for network names

co_stations <- riem_stations(network = 'CO_ASOS')

#View(co_stations)

stations <- c('AFF', 'FNL')

```

## Download station data

```{r}

af_p <- riem_measures(station='AFF',date_start = '2018-10-01',
                      date_end = '2019-09-30')


fc <- riem_measures(station='FNL',date_start = '2018-10-01',
                      date_end = '2019-09-30')

#View(fc)

```


## Convert both to daily

```{r}

daily_p <- fc %>% 
  bind_rows(af_p) %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(valid)) %>%
  group_by(date, station, lon, lat) %>%
  summarize(mean_temp = mean(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            min_temp = min(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            max_temp = max(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            daily_p = sum(p01i,na.rm=T)) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  as_tibble()

```


# Making videos 

## Boring first video

```{r}

slice_p <- daily_p %>%
  slice(1:20)

p1 <- ggplot(slice_p,aes(x=date,y=mean_temp,color=station,group=station)) + 
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = 'Date: {frame_time}', x='Date',y= 'Mean Temp (f)') + 
  transition_time(date) 


animate(p1, nframes=nrow(slice_p))


```


## Leaving a trace

```{r}
p2 <- ggplot(daily_p,aes(x=date,y=mean_temp,color=station,group=station)) + 
  geom_line() + 
  geom_point() +
  labs(title = '100 mile temp diff', x='Date',y= 'Mean Temp (f)') + 
  transition_reveal(date) + 
  scale_color_few()


animate(p2, nframes=nrow(daily_p))



```


## Static background plot


```{r}
usa <- us_states()

co <- usa %>%
  filter(name == 'Colorado')

sf_p <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326)


co_elev <- elevatr::get_elev_raster(co,z=6)

tm_shape(co) + 
  tm_polygons() + 
  tm_shape(co_elev) +
  tm_raster(style='cont',palette = 'Greens') + 
  tm_shape(sf_p) + 
  tm_dots(col='station',size=3,palette=c('red','white'))

```



## Quick plot

```{r}


  
basemap <- tm_shape(co) + 
    tm_polygons() + 
  tm_shape(co_elev) +
    tm_raster(style='cont',
              palette = 'Greens',
              title='Elevation (m)') 
```



```{r,eval=F}
 
full_dates <- unique(sf_p$date)

sequence <- 1:length(full_dates)
saveVideo({
  for(i in sequence){
  sub_sf <- sf_p %>%
    filter(date == full_dates[i]) %>%
    filter(daily_p > 0)
  

  if(nrow(sub_sf) > 0){
  finalmap <- basemap + tm_shape(sub_sf) + 
    tm_dots(col='station',
            size=2,
            palette = c('red','white'),
            legend.show = F) 
  }else{finalmap <- basemap}
  print(finalmap + 
          tm_layout(title=full_dates[i]) + 
          tm_add_legend(type='symbol',
                        labels=c('Air Force',
                                 'Fort Collins'),
                        col=c('red','white'),
                        title='Station'))
  }
},movie.name = 'precip_flash.mp4',
  interval=0.05,
  ani.width=1000,
  ani.height=800)


```

# A cooler video

## Let's see if we can see weather fronts by downloading all Colorado data and
## trying to get those to flash


```{r,eval=F}

all_co <- map(co_stations$id,~riem_measures(.x,date_start='2018-10-01',
                                         date_end = '2019-09-30'))
stack_co <- do.call('rbind',all_co)

daily_p <- stack_co %>% 
  mutate(date = as.Date(valid)) %>%
  group_by(date, station, lon, lat) %>%
  summarize(mean_temp = mean(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            min_temp = min(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            max_temp = max(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            daily_p = sum(p01i,na.rm=T)) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  as_tibble()

save(daily_p,file='DailyP.RData')
```

## Full state video

This code is almost identical to the above, but it uses all ASOS/AWOS precip
stations


```{r, eval=F}
load('DailyP.RData')

daily_sf <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(.,coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326,remove=F)




full_dates <- unique(daily_sf$date)

sequence <- 1:length(full_dates)
saveVideo({
  for(i in sequence){
  sub_sf <- daily_sf %>%
    filter(date == full_dates[i]) %>%
    filter(daily_p > 0)
  

  if(nrow(sub_sf) > 0){
  finalmap <- basemap + tm_shape(sub_sf) + 
    tm_dots(title.size='Daily Precip (in)',
            col='lon',
            size='daily_p',
            style='cont',
            palette='Oranges',
            legend.show = F,
            size.max=19,
            scale=3.5,
            sizes.legend=c(0,1,5,10,20))
  }else{finalmap <- basemap}
  print(finalmap + 
          tm_layout(title=full_dates[i],
        legend.position=c(0.7,0.2)))
  }
},movie.name = 'precip_flash_all.mp4',
  interval=0.12,
  ani.width=1000,
  ani.height=800)



```



# In Class work.

## GGanimate

Make a video showing the correlation between Air Force Academy and Fort Collins
between the min, mean, and max temps. The movie should cover the full year. 

```{r DIY_animate, warning=FALSE}
# create df
daily_t <- fc %>% 
  bind_rows(af_p) %>%
  mutate(date = as.Date(valid)) %>%
  group_by(date, station, lon, lat) %>%
  summarize(mean_temp = mean(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            min_temp = min(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            max_temp = max(tmpf,na.rm=T),
            daily_p = sum(p01i,na.rm=T)) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  select(-c(lat,lon,daily_p)) %>%
  pivot_longer(3:5,names_to = "measure",values_to = "temp") %>%
  as_tibble()

# create plot
t1 <- ggplot(daily_t,aes(x=date,y=temp,shape=station,
                         group=seq_along(temp),color=measure)) + 
  geom_point(aes(size=1)) +
  labs(title = '100 mile temp diff - min, max, mean', x='Date',y= 'Temp (f)') + 
  transition_reveal(date) + 
  scale_color_few()


# create animation
animate(t1, nframes=nrow(daily_t))


```



## (Animation package)

Make a video of mean temperature differences for the full Colorado dataset
(you need to download this [here](https://www.dropbox.com/s/s7zt18elgoh8q2b/DailyP.RData?dl=0)) first.

The video should look similar to the one above, but I want you to choose your own 
style (change the background, add other layers (like counties or cities)), etc...

Despite my best attempts at downloading and installing 'USAboundariesData', the package would not appear in my library. I ran the script by manually adding the datasets to my project folder and loading to the environment from that folder. I added the cities and counties dataset to my repository.

I was unable to create/play the video because I am missing "ffmpeg" (I am in R 3.5.1). I was unable to get the program installed on my computer. I never got the videos that you created running properly from the same issue. I tried testing this on my work computer (R 3.6.1), but I got the same error. Therefore, I saved the animation as a GIF instead of a MP4.


```{r DIY_video, warning=FALSE}
load('DailyP.RData')

# get spatial data frame
daily_sf <- daily_p %>%
  st_as_sf(.,coords=c('lon','lat'),crs=4326,remove=F)
  
# create a basemap - add counties
load("counties_contemporary_lores.rda")
co_counties <- counties_contemporary_lores %>%
  filter(state_abbr == "CO")
#co_counties <- us_counties(states = "CO")

basemap2 <- tm_shape(co) + 
    tm_polygons() + 
  tm_shape(co_elev) +
    tm_raster(style='cont',
              palette = 'Greens',
              title='Elevation (m)') 
county_map <- tm_shape(co_counties)+
  tm_borders(col="black")

# create video
full_dates <- unique(daily_sf$date)
sequence <- 1:length(full_dates)


saveGIF({
  for(i in sequence){
  sub_sf <- daily_sf %>%
    filter(date == full_dates[i])
  
  if(nrow(sub_sf) > 0){
  finalmap <- basemap2+ county_map + tm_shape(sub_sf) + 
    tm_dots(title.size='Mean Temperature (F)',
            col='mean_temp',
            size = 0.1,
            style='cont',
            palette='Reds',
            legend.show = T,
            scale=3.5)+
    tm_legend(outside=TRUE)
  }else{finalmap <- basemap2}
  print(finalmap + 
          tm_layout(title=full_dates[i],
        legend.position=c(0.7,0.2)))
  }
},movie.name = 'mean_temp_diff_all.gif',
  interval=0.12,
  ani.width=1000,
  ani.height=800)


```
